charges.charge_disposition: Bureau of Prisons 24 (twenty-four) months on Count 1 of the First Superseding Indictment. Supervised release 3 (three) years under the terms and conditions of the U.S. Probation Office and General Order 318 and obey all laws. Special assessment &;#036 ;100. Fines waived. RE-SENTENCING: Defendant placed on probation for a term of three (3) years on Count 1s. Comply with the rules and regulations of the Probation Office and General Order 318. Defendant is to serve 10 months home confinement. Defendant shall pay to the United States a special assessment in the amount of $100.00, which is due immediately. All fines are waived.
On Governments motion, remaining counts of the First Superseding Indictment and the underlying Indictment are ORDERED dismissed.
On Governments motion, remaining counts of the First Superseding Indictment and the underlying Indictment are ORDERED dismissed.

Defendant is hereby placed on Probation on each of Counts One and Two of the Second Superseding Information, all such terms to run concurrently, under the terms and conditions of the U.S. Probation Office and General Order 318. Special assessment of $200.00, due immediately. All fines are waived. Bond is hereby exonerated. The court informs the defendant of his right to appeal, which was waived.

Defendant is hereby placed on Probation on each of Counts One and Two of the Second Superseding Information, all such terms to run concurrently, under the terms and conditions of the U.S. Probation Office and General Order 318. Special assessment of $200.00, due immediately. All fines are waived. Bond is hereby exonerated. The court informs the defendant of his right to appeal, which was waived.
On Government's motion, all remaining count(s)/underlying indictment/information are hereby ordered dismissed.
On Government's motion, all remaining count(s)/underlying indictment/information are hereby ordered dismissed.
Defendant is placed on Probation for Three (3) years under the terms and conditions of the US Probation Office and General Order 318. Pay special assessment of $100, fines waives.
On government's motion, the remaining count(s) ordered dismissed

charges.charge_description: 18:510(b), 2 DELIVERING STOLEN TREASURY CHECKS, AIDING AND ABETTING AND CAUSING AN ACT TO BE DONE(10)

charges.charge_disposition: Defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of six months. Placed on supervised release for a term of two years. Defendant shall comply with the rules and regulations of the probation office and General Order 318. Defendant shall pay to the United States a special assessment of $100, which is due immediately. Defendant ordered to pay to the United States a total fine of $15,000. Defendant advised of right to appeal. Bond exonerated upon surrender.
On government's motion, the case is dismissed without prejudice
